review: I was very disappointed with the food.   Roasted  vegetables with my streak sounded so good, but could tell it was sitting out for hours then microwaved, before brought out.  Last time I eat there .

Place sucks azz.  My food was decent but a coworker and I were almost ignored.  We sat at the bar cause it was a little late and the bartender was having social time with all the other patrons.. Must have been have your friends to your workplace night. I would be appalled if I were the manager.  I will never go to another Fridays because of this place.  Fridays has got there stuff backwards!!   Do not go here!

The waitress was very nice and service very GOOD. Unfortunately, I wanted to order the Korean taco from the menu. The kitchen told the waitress that the meat taco was out! There is no option for me to order instead. :( The full bar with television looks so perfect to watch any sports games or whatever.

Good service as in the manager taking money off for the shitty food. I mean I order a med rare steak and it comes out well, mash potatoes tasted like plastic and my broccoli looked dead. This is the 3rd Fridays I've been too with just piss poor experiences
I got the blu cheese burger..I got it pretty quick but it was dry and the service sucked.
Worst TGI Fridays I have been in. We left after one drink because we were told if we ordered food we would be waiting a while.

I've been to this Friday's on two occasions to watch sports. The bar area is a good place to watch sports and socialize. Sometimes, the bar area becomes very crowded(popular sporting events & Fridays). I usually get the Jack Daniels shrimp with French fries if I'm hungry. The Jack Daniel shrimp is tasty. I haven't explored the menu a lot. I mainly come to Fridays for a drinks and watching sports. The service is hit or miss. The employees are friendly. I give this T.G.I. Friday a 3.5 rating.

Celebrated lunch with my girls. The waitor was pretty lame, and not very observant. He would walk over and ask if everything was okay at random times, but not notice that drinks were empty.... Twice we had to ask him for a re fill when he was oblivious. The food was good. I had a jack Daniels chicken sandwich.. Its a favorite of mine and never disapoints. I choose a side salad instead of fries and it was also good.  The strawberry lemonade was yummy too.
Terrible workers who need to be retrained just sitting around gossiping  all day,will never go there again!!

The worst experience I have ever had. The appetizers weren't out yet and the server asked us if we wanted our entrees because they were ready!!!   They obviously put the food under a heat lamp until we were ready which rendered it lukewarm when finally delivered.  Drink refills....forget about it. In 90 minutes I had one beer and had to ask three different people for a second. Finally, 20 minutes later that second beer came.  Quite possibly the worst food and experience I've had in sometime.

And so it's been a while since the last time I was at Friday's but glad I tried the new 2 for 10 menu today. The classic wedge salad and jack daniel's 6 oz sirloin with Mac 'n cheese (yummmm) and steamed broccoli  were so worthed and delicious! Not only that, I redeemed a free dessert of choice (bc I quickly DL their app while enjoying my meal). I picked the Tennessee whiskey cake! Ofc, it was saved til after work lol. The new triple berry smoothie reminds me if the strawberry daiquiri. Would've been extra nice if there were refills. Overall, I was pleased with my lunch and service
We went in on a Friday night, which is busy anywhere. We were seated right away, though. Service was slow because of a lot of large parties, but the food was all good.

How do I start with how horrible this visit to Friday's was.  First, being one of only three tables being served, you'd think we'd get fast service. That's not the case. It took FOREVER to get the salad and come to find out the salad comes with the entree. Ok where they do that at? Laburnum Fridays is where! Second, once the meal finally came we were eating cold salad with a hot meal.  The rest was complaining to the manager about EVERYTHING. She had more excuses then I had reasons to complain.  To make this short. The service got worst instead of better after talking to the manager. I watched as people that came in after I did get service from more than one person while we waited being ignored.  Again I asked for the same manager this time to make it very clear that I wasn't going to be ignored and watch everyone around me get waited on. She insulted me by going away and coming back with the check and reduced it by half. I advised her to go back and bring me the full check because I wasn't excepting her attempt to pacify me.  Thanks to YELP I can put them on blast. Used to be a great place to go with friends for drinks but one bad experience can prevent a return visit.  Maybe this will make a difference for someone else to think twice maybe three times before going. Bad experiences get retold a million times thanks to internet & social media.

Here on a lunch break, I was seated immediately & my waiter was there before I looked up.  Quick service, as well as a perk of chips & salsa for being a Stripes Member, while I wait for my order. Thanks for Quick & Excellent service!

I give 2 stars because the waitress was nice, and when my food finally came it was tasty. That being said-tiny portions for large price, and I thought we would starve to death waiting for food to show up. The teeny amount of chips and salsa that took 30 min to come was also good but too little too late. Not eager to come back.
Service is best at the bar: some of the bartenders are good, some are great. They all do a good job and service isn't slow like in the dining areas.
Didn't expect a club seen at TGIF, but I had a good time & the food was great as well!

Absolutely the worst service. Waited over an hour for DRINKS from the bar, and the server did not care at all...but his friends at the table next to us were served within 10 minutes. Ordered an appetizer and were never given silverware, and had to ask a manager for napkins. (Even then we were only given three napkins for a party of five.)  I wish I could give negative stars.

Literally the worst service I have ever had in a restaurant. This is an awesome place if you like waiting half an hour or longer for drinks. Waitress wouldn't even look at our table. Gives TGI Friday's a bad name. I don't plan to ever patron one again, even in other cities.

Had a so-so experience here. The major problem was our waitress was super-young and had no idea what she was doing.  Made many, many trips to communicate basic information, such as "we are out of Michelob Ultra," etc.  Our food arrived in a chaotic fashion over a prolonged period.  One burger was way-overcooked, and had to be re-done.  Its replacement was fine.     Food was standard, TGI Fridays-level stuff, maybe a touch below par. Also oddly unsettling: a uniformed police officer standing guard and patrolling the place.  How rowdy does this crowd get?  Maybe his presence was deterring what would have elsewise been coarse behavior.      I would come here again, but I hope that next time my waitron knows what they are doing.

I paid $12.50 for what amounted to a burger I would expect from McDonald's.  They decided to turn up the volume of the music to the point that my party could not speak to each other - we couldn't even hear each other while shouting.  The service was unbearably slow. It took about 45 minutes for a burger, and 10 mins for a beer.  The tap beer is flat - do not order it. The waiter did a nice job working with the system in which he is trapped.  I do not plan to come back, I would not recommend to a friend.

Really can't give any stars because I didn't eat anything.  I was so pissed off after standing at the host stand and the manager with gossiping with a host (she has freckles and a little ponytail) and they didn't pay me attention or great me until they finished laughing at what ever they were talking about and the manager looked up and walked Away.  Then the host said she was going to call the Togo taker but she never came after standing there waiting over 5 min.  I just left.  No customer service, the staff looks like they don't care anything about appearance from the hair to the sagging clothes.....

Here hanging out with my BFF for the kickoff of her birthday weekend.  Started out with the Ultimate Blueberry-Pom Long Island Tea.  It has blueberry vodka, gin, triple sec, rum, blueberries, pomegranate, lime juice, fresh lemonsugar and sprite!  Perfect combo!  Sweet, tart, & delish!   I wasn't sure I was going to order any food, but decided to check out the menu to see if there was anything new on it.  Didn't try anything new, but ordered my "go to" app of Sesame Jack Chicken Strips, then even ordered some Vanilla Bean Cheesecake to go. I like how they do have music on Friday nights, on top of multiple TVs in the bar area to show various sports events.

I've been here before, and this place has seriously gone downhill. The food was okay, but my steak was extremely chewy to the point of me being unable to eat it. It was also a bit undercooked. The waitress barely came by to check on us. Don't come at night if you don't want to be at an incredibly noisy place, we couldn't hear ourselves think.

Came into the restaurant for a late dinner after 12 hours of driving. We were tired,cranky and hungry.  Our server, Lyniece, was at our table within minutes to take our drink order. We ordered our drinks and food at the same time. The drinks came immediately followed by our food. Lyniece was friendly and attentive to our every need!   The food was great and we left there quite full no longer cranky but still tired!

The staff seem pretty nice but they were batting nothing tonight food came out cold and not done we ordered one thing and got another. The waiter couldn't remember what we ordered I'm still waiting on my water. And the place is not that packed

This place is ghetto and very unprofessional. The waiters were rude and very slow. They did not welcome us at all. I wish I could give it 0 stars. I will never come here again. They need to hire new staff.

I really wanted to give this two stars but decided on three only because the service was significantly better on this trip than the previous two. To start the food isn't great and I think they don't do a very good job of trying to make it good either. Limited portions and slow delivery of food is the killer here. I receive my chicken and spinach plate 10 minutes before the rest of my party of two received there food. I will more than likely be visiting this place again but only because it is so close to the hotel I stay at when in town. Good luck to this Friday's on keeping its doors open.

Came here as a second option and it still was better to stop maybe anywhere else.  Ordered the endless appetizer and you can only stay with one appetizer on the list.  Then I choose the wrong appetizer the spicy chicken something. And it was four tortillas chips with mainly cabbage and tomatoes.  I had one small chicken on each one.  Then the bartender left on me and never even said a word.  Never going back worst $22.00 spent.
Terrible service, never got waited on!!! We left after being completely ignored by the wait staff and manager!  Never going back!!!

Went 2 weeks ago, around 4pm. The waitress was average.. and they didnt have the prime rib that I went there for. Although disappointed, I wish that I could say that was the end of my troubles. The problem was the booth that I sat at smelled horrible! It was a cross between bad BO and mildew! Ugh! It was so unbearably bad that I asked to be moved. Im not sure if a previous guest just had a bad case of BO and it stuck to those ripped up seat cushions...or if that place just needs a good cleaning. Either way...Im not going back!

Waiter was terrible! Service was slow and food was nasty! Sent back everything and still ended up paying for a drink I sent back and when questioning the waiter he acted like he had no idea what was going on but no shocker there....he was clueless all night

This is the worst tgif ive ever been to, service was horrible me and my boyfriend ordered appetizers , the waitress obviously wasnt paying attention when we ordered because she brought out everything we didnt order then walked away before I could even tell her it was wrong .Then we tried to find her ,5 minutes later I see her outside the window smoking and talking on her phone, Really???? After that we paid for our drinks and left.
Wish I could give a review of staff or food, but we were unable to stay longer than 10 min.  The restaurant smelled so bad that we were forced to leave.

I have to agree with the bad smell from a previous review. It wasn't overpowering, but funky The bar area wasn't kept clean. The burger was good, the bartender was not very attentive. It was just ok, but I won't be back.

First, almost 90% of patron is black. I saw couple of white people and few spanish, no asian people. Not much diversity here.   Second, maybe i got lucky with waiter, but my service was fine. Host was nice but they are not effective.  Alot of empty tables but people have to wait 20 min or 30min to seat. They are having hard time seating people.I will put blame on the manger for that, they should either help out or train host better. For bad, drinks are really bad. Almost like bartender have no ideal what they are doing or dont care about their job, order 3 different drinks. All of them was pretty bad. Their is no balance in the drink. Drink are 70% fill to top. They really need to get train. Food was ok. Not great. Once again they need to train kitchen staff.  Order shrimp paste. There were about 3 or 4 small shrimp in my paste. Wing sauce was good, but wing was little undercooked.

This place is kind of a mess. I've been to quite a few Friday's locations, and I'm afraid this ranks among the worst of them. Parking was a bit hard to find in the busy lot, though my friend and I managed. We were greeted by the hostess who, judging by the speed of her ability to seat us at an empty table, was new to the location. In fact, many of the employees I interacted with that evening seemed new. That should be your first warning sign: poor-performing restaurants have high employee turnover, and thus new employees on a near-constant basis. We waited a while for our server to come over, and when she did she seemed to be in a great rush (a surprise, since from my observation she didn't appear to have more than two tables including us). We made our drink order and she returned with it shortly. We placed our orders (the make-your-own burgers) and I showed her my Friday's card, which is what I've always presented to get the complimentary chips and salsa. She didn't read our order back to us or acknowledge the card and, as expected, no chips came, nor did she make any callbacks before the entrees arrived to allow me to ask for some. Shame. When the food arrived, both of our orders were incorrect. The server didn't even notice this despite delivering the food herself, and she apologized when we pointed out the issues. It took about 10 more minutes to fix the orders, and she got us some refills after the fixed orders were brought to us. The sole positive part of this evening was that the food, once corrected, was excellent. It was clear the orders had been expedited in the kitchen (cheese wasn't fully melted), though it was still delicious and the ingredients tasted fresh and flavorful. A manager stopped by to ask how our experience had been, though decided to do so as our server was almost right next to him, ruining the chance for any constructive criticism to be conveyed. Another employee we hadn't seen before this point brought us a to-go container despite the fact that we were both done with our food. Thanks? Finally we received the check, and I offered her the coupon code from my phone and a manager had to run her through the process of how it worked. We were glad to be paid and out of there. Bottom line, the food at Friday's is actually good, and the coupons offered here make it very affordable, though the poor service makes you wonder if trips here are worth it. Overall: 2.0 stars ----------- Pros: - Great food and decent portions. - Coupons/rewards program makes it cheap to dine here. Cons: - Atrocious/rushed service. - Bar area seemed incredibly loud, glad we didn't eat in that section. - New staff slow down what should be a fairly expeditious experience. - Not much parking in their private lot.

TGI Fridays is one of my favorite restaurants but the one in Laburnum is starting to go down with their customer service and up keep. Lately they always have a bathroom out of order and not kept clean. The service is not consistent sometimes it's good and sometimes it's not. The dine and drink is good you pick from a certain menus where you get a meal and a drink for $12.00. I have had the Peach Long Island and Jack Daniels chicken and the sirloin

It took forever to be seated, when I was seated I was placed next to a loud family. The waitress seemed confused... It was a miserable experience. When the food came, it was ok. The Chicken tenders came 5 minutes after my husbands boneless wings...Shoudlnt they have had a similar cooking time.

First and foremost we weren't really greeted by the host staff. More like "oh great I have to do my job" Restaurant wasn't busy at all yet host stand had all of 1 menu to give me and my girlfriend to share. (Eventually we got another menu) we were sat in a completely empty section with the exception of the servers hanging out. It took 25 min (again restaurant not busy) for our server to arrive. Didn't seem interested in doing her job. Took roughly 10 more min for drinks. Food was good no complaints there BUT the service was just...not what I was expecting. Our server got her food before we did which was unsettling( meaning she got food shoved it in a box across from us and continued laughing and joking with the other servers not working) hell I had to stare her down to get a refill Half way through the meal our check was literally thrown on our table. No do you need boxes, dessert, anything smh. Now being a former server I believe in the power of tipping but in this case I consider the $2 I left generous for the BS my girlfriend and I received today by Ashley. PS most of their staff looks dingy it's very off putting. No standards here. This place has taken a turn for the worst.

Slow slow service, tiny portions for kids, food tasted strange and it's expensive !  - only thing that came fast was the check - halfway through dinner ! First time I've been to  TGI Friday in a long time and definitely the last !

Fridays has sure improved the service and quality of food. My husband and I had a great meal and quick service. Also, happy hour drinks only $3.00 on Thursdays and they sure didn't skimp on the alcohol. Met the manager to express our happiness with the improvements. Got the Jack Daniels ribeye and cooked perfectly. Melted like butter in the mouth. My husband got sizzling chicken and cheese and cooked perfectly. We will be back soon.

This location at White Oak is a little different than many of the other TGI Fridays you might have visited. I will say it has a lot more color and that the people rule frequent there are a little bit more unseemly than they should be. The staff is usually wonderful and the food is pretty on time. Just be prepared for people who maybe don't have as much home training as they should.

I won't eat here again, not only because I am from out of town but management was terrible. Luke warm pasta and 2 pieces of chicken in my pasta dish. Given I had them hold the shrimp it still was $15 dish. After speaking with the manager his resolution was a $4.50 comp which honestly is the most pathetic excuse for a 'sorry' I've ever gotten. I will be contacting someone higher up. This was unacceptable

This place is trash as hell, been sitting at the bar for 20 mins and haven't even been greeted or asked if I would like something to drink. She's talked to the couple sitting beside me three different occasions and looks past me like me and my friend aren't even sitting here. If I could rate this establishment a 0 stars I would. Waste of a trip out to Fridays. If I would have known any better I would have went ANYWHERE else but here. When we asked the bartender if would could order something to eat she scrunched up her face and said nothing, just walked off and continues to make drinks. This is the worst example of customer service a business can offer.
The worst Fridays ever. Rude bartender who was not friendly. Then had the nerve to charge me for a premium drink during Happy Hour. Don't worry I will never come to this place again
Waiting for my waitress to return I ordered the never ending but our waitress has vanished no refills on our beverage also

We just wanted an easy, quick lunch on our way home from the river. We should've realized something was off when we walked into the Very Cold, nearly-empty restaurant and were seated Right Next to a woman having a contentious discussion on speakerphone with her baby-daddy.  With said baby loudly begging for momma's attention-and calling momma 'ugly'. I tried to order a lunch combo (French onion soup and a lunch sized salad), and was told the soup (a printed menu item) was not available. Since I didn't want a house salad and a lunch sized salad for my combo (they have very limited combo offers), I ordered the chipotle chicken salad ($12). Big mistake. The salad tasted like a salt block. I think I found three shreds of cheese, and had two small sightings of what appeared to be avocado. The 'chipotle' chicken was ice-cold and so salty I couldn't even take the uneaten portion as a snack for my dogs. Not to mention the texture of the chicken was mushy. Even the 'tortilla' pieces were Beyond stale. I couldn't, wouldn't eat it. Husband's lunch combo looked like they had pulled it out of a vat of grease...the same stuff they must use to mop the floors, which were somewhat sticky-slick. We got the check and left, full portions remaining on the table. Something we've never done, we simply could not get out fast enough. Needless to say, we won't be back. No way, no how. There are too many decent places in the immediate area.
Got to restaurant and seated at 1pm.  Got food at 1:30.  Long wait.   Bathrooms smelled like a dirty truck stop off he highway. Not clean.  This location is bringing down the Fridays brand.

Every single time I come here the service is horrible. It takes forever to be greeted, then once your order is taken it takes forever to get your drinks. Food comes out pretty decent, however if something is wrong with it or you need something else you have to wait a very long period of time before anyone comes to check on you! I still tip my waitress/waiter a pretty good amount because I know that they work for 2.13 an hour, but if you lack patience and tip based off of service, I recommend you stay far away from this location as I plan on doing the same!

Had a call in order and the person taking the order could not quite process that a hamburger with cheese and a cheeseburger are actually the same thing. Also ordered the bruschetta chicken pasta with an extra side of the balsamic glaze. When I got my order there was NO balsamic glaze on my pasta or as a side. Now having to make my own glaze to go on my food. Diner beware.

WHAT HAS HAPPENED TO FRIDAYS !! The food tastes like it came out of a box... drinks super strong and no flavor, if I knew I would have gotten a shot..  I guess that's why they are closing down.. what a shame.
Service was slow even tho when they weren't busy, waitress was nice, food wasn't good as we were spect, drinks were bad as well.

Bad Service. Ordered endless apps. I ate half of what I wanted because the rest of my party wasn't interested in waiting another 20+ minutes for me to get 5 more bites of food. Then the bills were wrong. 35 minutes after we "finished" eating, we finally got to leave.
I went tonight and had a great time, drinks were lovely as well as the food. The user or server Matthew was absolutely amazing. He made me smile the whole time.

Worst experience I've ever had in a restaurant. My tour group stopped off for a one hour lunch. Multiple large parties came in for lunch at noon and the restaurant was pretty much empty. Waited 50 minutes with terrible service and the food never came out. We asked for checks because we had to leave and even that took 20 minutes. Instead of comping our meals they still charged us and brought them to us in to-go boxes.

We came here during lunch hours, we've been waiting for 7 burgers and chicken wings for over an hour. There were only few people inside, Walter D. ( manager ) shame on you, you can't manage people and don't know how to do it.

I like to sit at the bar at most canned joint and TGI Friday is no exception. Service is usually decent and consistent like average.  However it is not the case at this place. I cannot recall when last I had such shoddy service. Absolutely pathetic. The barman seemed to think he was here to entertain the ladies and not serve customers other than maybe if theu were regulars. His backup ignored me. Took longer for me to get a drink and pay the bill than wait for and eat my food. Like I said just pathetic. At least the food was as per usual.

My chicken for the Jack Daniel chicken burger was raw AH. I'm so upset. I purchased it today on 7/08/17z I'm really upset about this and the fact that I can go back and get a refund upsets me highly. When I went to collect the food it was completely full so I don't know if they were just rushing to get the food out but the chicken hard not cooked all the way thru.

Wow, the service here was pretty rough.  I have to give a shoutout for the unlimited appetizers for $12, though.  That's pretty cool when you have a group together. We rolled in around 10pm on a Monday night, it wasn't too busy, but there were people there.  The dining area was really dark, so we moved into the bar.  Like the other one-million places like this, they had a good selection on the menu and a good mix of draft beers including a few locals. The problem was that our service was just slow and kind of non-existant at times!  On top of that, when our meatballs came out, they were cold inside!  Ugh!  I guess we should've gone with Applebees...never thought I'd say that.

The service is slow we got the endless apps and we have been sitting here for about 30 minutes and we only received one order off the apps my Husband got his food before me and is done I still have not received my food. And it is not even busy. I'm over it

Went in at 4:45 for dinner expecting things to be relatively quick as we were one of three guests in the restaurant. Sadly, this was not the case. 1) Apparently they have subtracted from their endless app options (which the server didn't know and had to hunt for a menu that listed them) They also increased the price to $15. Given that you receive a fraction of what you normally would have received AND it takes you forever to get a second round of "endless" options... this is a rip off.  2) I had a coupon for a free half rack of ribs and two sides. Nowhere on the coupon does it say I could not order "upgraded" sides. Had to pay the difference, which was minimal but it should still say that. The macaroni and cheese was noodles drenched in cheese sauce with a little bit of shredded cheese on top to make it look like they made an attempt. The ribs were burnt and barely there. The onion rings were the saving grace on this plate.  3) When you prebus a table you DO NOT TAKE YOUR GUESTS DRINK. I get the server was not the best but some things are just common sense. And it shouldn't take you 15 minutes to figure out how to process a check. Literally. 15 minutes from the point of drop off to point of payment.  This was one of the saddest experiences I have ever had. If this is the type of service they provide on the regular... I'll eat at IHOP.

The service was great, but the food wasn't. I love TGI Fridays, but this location is always a hit or miss. I ordered the Sizzling Chicken and Shrimp and my chicken, the cheese under the chicken and fries were over cooked. I would suggest that the Chefs take more time to prepare the food properly.

The best thing about my experience here was the service. I am not sure of her name but the young lady at the bar was very welcoming, she said hi, asked my name, and told me hers.  She then let me know the specials and took my drink order on the spot.     The food left something to be desired, I ordered the 3 sliders and they were just ok.  I wasn't super hungry so I didn't order much else, just some fries.  The fries were just ok as well, I was hoping for better fries but didn't have high expectation for the food since these types of restaurants have seemed to on the slide.      I would come back here again just for the service.  This visit was to waste some time and just have a drink after the busy day and that was achieved.  So overall it is a location I would come back to again, and possibly after that experience the rating my change, but the service was great.

So I am currently sitting in this Friday's with 8 others. They all received their food before I did because my order was messed up. The waitress took the order correctly but the kitchen staff could not get it together. The bun was not the correct bun, the sandwich did not have the spicy mayo on it. I made the waitress take the sandwich back for the second time to correct the bun and add the sauce. By time my food was brought out to me with the right bun and spicy mayo my entire party was done eating their food. I was very upset and told them to give me a box so I could just take the food home. I will never be coming back here again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
